text: Visit the University of Sioux Falls

There's nothing like visiting the University of Sioux Falls and taking a tour of our beautiful campus to better understand what it's like to be a USF Cougar! Check out our visit options and let us know when you're ready to visit USF and we'll take care of the planning for you.

Request your visit by filling out the form below for a campus preview day or create your own visit day.  If you have questions about visiting USF, please give us a call at (605) 331-6600 or toll-free at (800) 888-1047 or check out the
Do you have any family members who have graduated from the University of Sioux Falls?
Please provide the following information about your family members or relatives who graduated from USF.
List the high school or college(s) previously attended.
When do you plan to attend USF?
Additional people Visiting With You? Mom, dad, grandma, best friend?  They're all welcome, just let us know!
Select which visit experience you would like.
Sign me up for a Campus Preview Day

Campus Preview Days are great days if you're interested in gathering general info, experiencing our community, touring campus, eating in the Caf', or getting specific questions answered about your major with others visiting campus.  Preview Days typically start at 10:30 and wrap up around 2:30.
I'd like to create my own visit (M-F)

On most days an individual visit can be tailored to your interests.  A campus visit will consist of meeting with admissions, financial aid and a student led campus tour so don't forget to wear your walking shoes.  Additional requests to meet with faculty, fine arts directors, coaches, sit in on a specific class, or stay overnight with a current student are available when classes are in session.  Don't worry if classes are not in session, we schedule visits with admissions and give campus tours year round.
Sign me up for a Saturday visit

Our office is open on select Saturday mornings during the academic year from 10:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. for a presentation from an admission counselor and a student-led campus tour. If you're looking for a more in-depth visit, please consider scheduling your visit on a weekday.

Campus presentations and tour go from 10:30 am till 1:00 pm.         If you have time in your schedule, we invite you to stay for lunch in our dining hall                 and select additional people to meet with during your visit.
Would you like to attend our Fine Arts audition workshop? (9:30 - 10:15 a.m.)
Do you plan to eat lunch with us during your visit?
Start your connection with a Fine Arts Director by filling out the Fine Arts Recruitment Questionnaire after you submit your campus visit request.

Professor meetings are available when the university is in session and subject to faculty availability. Certain programs have minimum academic requirements. We understand the importance of meeting with a professor and will make every attempt to coordinate a visit with a professor when classes are not in session.
Select from the following options to customize your personal visit:
Meet with a Fine Arts Director

Not all coaches are on campus every day and we will make every attempt to coordinate a visit. Start your connection with a coach by filling out the Athletic Recruitment Questionnaire after you submit your campus visit request.
Do you have an athletic competition on this visit day?
Meet with the Honors Program Director
Chapel visits are only available on Tuesday during the school year at 10:00 am.  If you request a visit on a day other than Tuesday we will schedule you to visit with our campus pastor.
Overnight accommodations are available Monday through Thursday between September 1 and May 1. We will not be able to accommodate requests during holiday breaks or during final exam week.
If the date of your visit meets this criteria, would you like to schedule an overnight visit?
When do you want to stay with a USF Student?
Please let us know what you are hoping for in your overnight visit.  Would you like to stay with an athlete in a specific sport, a fine arts student, a campus ministry student, specific major, etc.?

You can take your academic experience and your career to the next level. The University of Sioux Falls (USF) graduate programs will help you get more leadership skills and confidence so you can make more of an impact in your community.
Both online and on USF’s campus in Sioux Falls, South Dakota, you can become part of our Christian fellowship of students while getting an accredited advanced degree.

USF’s Master of Business Administration graduate programs give you the strategic and critical-thinking skills needed to boost your career. The Vucurevich School of Business has received specialized accreditation for its business programs through the International Assembly for Collegiate Business Education (IACBE).

If you are a lifelong learner, this graduate program through the Fredrikson School of Education offers convenient, affordable degrees for on-the-job educators looking to pursue an advanced degree, non-educators seeking initial certification, and people pursuing careers in adult and higher education.

The University is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission, the Fredrikson School of Education is accredited by the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP), and the Ed.S. degree programs are approved by the South Dakota Department of Education. This USF program gives working professionals a unique growth experience via two tracks: superintendent or principal. The graduate program includes summer coursework in condensed time frames with an online component. Opportunities for licensure/certification are included.

This privacy policy applies to the website operated by the University of Sioux Falls referred to as "USF" herein.

Except as described below, USF does not collect or require visitors to the website to furnish personally identifying information such as names, email addresses, and phone numbers. Like most website operators, USF does collect non-personally identifying information that web browsers and servers typically make available, such as the browser type, operating system, language preference, referring site and date and time of each visitor request. USF also collects potentially-personally identifying information like Internet Protocol (IP) addresses. These are non-personally identifying in and of themselves, but could be used in conjunction with other information to personally identify users.

USF's purpose in collecting this information is to better understand how USF's visitors use its website. To that end, USF may share potentially-personally identifying information with its employees, contractors, service providers, and subsidiaries. USF will not publicly release potentially-personally identifying information except under the same circumstances as USF releases personally identifying information.

Where USF has collected personally identifying information, it discloses that information only to those of its employees, contractors, service providers, and subsidiaries that need to know that information in order to process it on USF's behalf and that have agreed not to disclose it to others. Additionally, USF may need to transfer personally identifying information to an affiliate or successor in the event of a change of our corporate structure or status, such as in the event of a restructuring, sale, or bankruptcy. We will retain any personally identifying information for the period necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in this privacy policy.
USF does not rent or sell personally identifying information to anyone.

A cookie is a string of information that a website stores on a visitor's computer, and that the visitor's browser provides to the website each time the visitor returns. Most major websites use cookies. Because the browser provides this cookie information to the website at each visit, cookies serve as a sort of label that allows a website to "recognize" a browser when it returns to the site. The domain name in USF cookies will clearly identify their affiliation with USF and, where applicable, its third-party service provider.

USF's website uses cookies to help USF identify and track visitors, their usage of the USF website, and their website access preferences across multiple requests and visits to USF's website. The basic idea is to gather aggregate data about how people use the USF website. The term usually used to describe this is "web analytics" and the cookies are the tools by which a website owner collects this web analytics data.

USF will use the web analytics data only to determine aggregate usage patterns for our website as described above. The USF website does this by using either our own internal analytics software or by sending this information to a third-party service provider to help USF analyze this data. USF has agreements with its third-party service providers that they will not share this information with others or use the information for purposes other than to maintain the services they provide to USF. It is possible to link cookies to personally identifying information, thereby permitting website operators, including our third-party analytics providers, to track the online movements of particular individuals. USF does not do so and its third-party service providers are not allowed to correlate USF data with any other data.

USF uses the information provided by cookies to develop a better understanding of how USF's visitors use USF's website, and to facilitate those visitors' interactions with USF's website. USF may make the aggregate data obtained from web analytics (including from our third-party analytics providers, if applicable) publicly available. If this data is made available, none of the information will be personally identifying information or potentially-personally identifying information.
How to Control the Use of Cookies.

You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. USF visitors who do not wish to have cookies placed on their computers by USF, its contractors, or third-party service providers should set their browsers to refuse cookies before linking to USF's website. Certain features of USF's website may not function properly without the aid of cookies.
If you do not want data about your visits to the USF website to be collected by Google Analytics, you can install the

. The add-on keeps your visits anonymous and prohibits any data from being sent to Google Analytics. Additionally, if you signed up to receive but no longer wish to receive electronic marketing communications from USF, you can opt-out from receiving these communications by following the “unsubscribe” instructions in any such communication you receive.
USF's website is not directed to individuals under the age of thirteen (13), and we request that such individuals do not provide personally identifying information through our website.

Consistent with our privacy commitments, we will scrutinize third party requests for information about you for compliance with the law, including those coming from governmental agencies or civil litigants. We may access, use, preserve or disclose information about you only when we have a good faith belief that it is reasonably necessary to do so to satisfy the applicable law, regulation, legal process or lawful governmental request of any country, or to protect the rights, property or safety of USF, its users or the public. We will provide notice of legal process or governmental requests unless prohibited to do so by law or the circumstances warrant otherwise.

By using the website, you agree to the terms and conditions of this privacy policy. If you do not agree to the terms and conditions of this privacy policy, please do not use the website. USF may change its Privacy Policy from time to time. Any and all changes will be reflected on this page
